PlantSection.title: Tulips
PlantSection.subtitle: Tulips are a genus of spring-blooming perennial herbaceous bulbiferous geophytes. The flowers are usually large, showy and brightly coloured, generally red, pink, yellow, or white.
PlantSection.funFact: Holland is still the largest producer of tulips

PlantSection.title: Rose
PlantSection.subtitle: A rose is either a woody perennial flowering plant of the genus Rosa, in the family Rosaceae, or the flower it bears.
PlantSection.funFact: Roses Are One of the Oldest Flowers. It's no wonder that roses have been referenced in literature and music for centuries.

PlantSection.title: Pumpkin
PlantSection.subtitle: A pumpkin is a cultivar of winter squash that is round with smooth, slightly ribbed skin, and is most often deep yellow to orange in coloration.
PlantSection.funFact: Over 1.5 billion pounds of pumpkin are produced each year in the United States.

PlantSection.title: Tomatoes
PlantSection.subtitle: The tomato is the edible berry of the plant Solanum lycopersicum, commonly known as the tomato plant. The species originated in western South America, Mexico, and Central America.
PlantSection.funFact: There Are Over 10 Thousand Varieties Of Tomato.

PlantSection.title: Potatoes
PlantSection.subtitle: The potato is a starchy tuber of the plant Solanum tuberosum and is a root vegetable native to the Americas.
PlantSection.funFact: The potato is about 80% water and 20% solids.
